channel.title: How to change Client title? [PI]
channel.description: I cant find where to change the title, I look all though the client side and went to every .java class (even client.java) and couldn't find it. Can someone help.

I Wont be an Ass
Use the god damn ZFile Searcher -.-

@Christmas_tree wrote:

item.title: How to change Client title? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

PI is a server, not a client. The file name varies amoung clients. It could be GUI.java or Jframe.java. So, when you refer to PI and it isn’t about a server, you’re wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: How to change Client title? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @C2dahizzy C2dahizzy
item.description:
@C2dahizzy wrote:

[quote=“Krajix, post:2, topic:478421”]You can easily do this by opening up the Gui.java file, and scrolling ALL the way down to the bottom. There, you find a code like:

Whatever the client name is, change it to your own. Now you have done that, go onto Edit in notepad, and click on Find. Put in the text bar, the default name of the client before you put in your own, and change that also, to your own client name. There are two parts where you must do this, and that is what you have just done! Save it, and compile.[/quote]
I don’t have a GUI.java class… that’s delta, I have PI

Read full topic

item.title: How to change Client title? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

You can easily do this by opening up the Gui.java file, and scrolling ALL the way down to the bottom. There, you find a code like:

Whatever the client name is, change it to your own. Now you have done that, go onto Edit in notepad, and click on Find. Put in the text bar, the default name of the client before you put in your own, and change that also, to your own client name. There are two parts where you must do this, and that is what you have just done! Save it, and compile.

Read full topic
